course.title: The State in Neoliberal Times
course.description: Instead of declining with the spread of neoliberalism, in many parts of the world states are taking on new and unexpected responsibilities, with critical effects on citizenship, poverty, health, and more. Anthropologists have taken note. Drawing on new texts in the anthropologies of governance and science, this course examines state reason, state practices, and networked ties to other governing entities (corporations, scientists, NGOs, citizen groups) with the aim of understanding what we mean by "the state" and why states matter in today's world. This course is designed to help students currently developing PhD projects incorporate an interest in the state into their fieldwork.
